Row.Text: Sejong is pleased you have little Science and Culture
Sejong is disappointed with your Science and Culture
Neo-Confucianism

Friendly to backwards civilizations that are lacking in [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture. Dislikes civilizations that are ahead of him in [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture.
I am Sejong, the bringer of calm order where once was violent division.
Joseon will be freed from your bad influence!
Too long has your shadow darkened our land! We will not wait for you to come - we come to you!
The true scholar leads, and provides an example for others to follow.
To take a step down a false path is not progress.
You may defeat my armies and pillage my cities. But you can never erase the grudge that we will bear against you in our hearts.
We may lead each other in the Way.
I must choose well those with whom I would associate.
We only grow by learning from our friends.
Peace will work - so long as we know our respective roles.
You tread like an ox over the boundaries we so properly make.
We took your delegation to the ancient lake at Anapji, where we wrote poetry and set wine cups afloat in the dusk. Your delegates' poems were… not great.
We mind our borders well, mind you mind yours.
Here - a surasang! Dishes of every thing good to eat in Joseon - sura, jjim, tang, and nine different kinds of kimchi.
Words spoken in anger can have no productive utility.
You have fallen far into error here. (Denounces You)
Your lands impress, though still we long for home.
Indeed.
We should understand the others' lands, that we might better learn.
How may we learn from each other today?
A ship will sail faster with two masts, is it not so?
At the end of hardship comes happiness.
We carry a grudge, still.
Your lands impress, though still we long for home.
Let us walk together, and grow.
We simply do not trust you enough.
We can expand our knowledge together if we have increased amity between our people.
I did not become a great king by ignoring threats on my border.
This cannot be.
We will grow together.
Munich
(You have filled your cities with districts.)
(You are not filling your cities with all possible districts.)
Ludwig is pleased that you are lagging behind on building districts.
Ludwig is unhappy you are filling your cities with districts.
Eternal Enigma
Likes civilizations that do not keep the maximum number of Districts in each city. Dislikes civilizations that build as many districts as possible.
I am Ludwig of Bavaria, King of these lands and the embodiment of the Swan-Knight of legend.
Villain! You are as despicable as that Count Telramund! As that Fafnir!
Have at you, then! We shall write new legends of this day!
You know well how to treasure the forests and lakes of your homeland.
You order your cities like a ledger: here is where the scientists go, that zone is for poets. Banality.
Perhaps we may meet on the way between the Wood and the World.
I wholeheartedly accept your friendship. Now can I be alone?
What do I need of friends, when I have music and art?
Let us be companions! So long as we do not have to meet often. And you will have to wear a mask.
Fantastic. Please go away.
Too bad. Please go away.
Your delegation attended a nine-hour performance of German romantic music in my capital. I could see tears in their eyes by the end of it, they loved it so much.
I have plans that night. I plan to read and to ponder the rain in the trees.
I have sent to you one hundred swans- I have sent to you fifty sw- Excuse me, I have not tied them down well. I have sent you a swan.
That’s… that's not very nice of you.
My code of chivarly commands me to condemn you as a villain and a traitor. There. You are condemned. (Denounces You)
Come, and see the swan grotto. See the towers and spires of my home.
So be it.
Sing me the songs of your lands! Do you have swans?
I was just reading here. Who are you again?
Shall we ally? Here, you may wear this cloak and mask.
Were we at war?
I have been collecting the most thrilling tales of valor from my warriors; I cannot stop now.
I have just been told that we were at war! With people trying to kill each other! This is wonderful in stories, but let us stop it now.
You may visit my woods and streams, my palaces and castles. Just check to see that I'm not there first.
Oh, the ferocity of the wood-spirits would terrify you if you came close! It is better this way.
We seek tales of far-off lands!
The firey heart of chivalry beats in my soldiers' chests as they gaze out upon your massing troops. I beg you do not tempt them into absolutely glorious acts of derring-do!
I have a forty-foot monument to the Swan Knight to build and cannot do it with such deals.
Lovely. We will have a reception in the grotto. At night, of course.
+{1_num} [ICON_Faith] Faith from the adjacent {1_Num : plural 1?Farm; other?Farms;}.
New Rome
Tries to build up [ICON_Culture] Culture, and likes civilizations that also focus on [ICON_Culture] Culture.
I am Theodora, who came from nothing to the throne on naught but dreams.
Nobody puts the empress in a corner.
My people demand a better life. You stand in the way of that becoming.
We create power with props and stage sets, with poetry and grace.
Surely there is more to life than what you offer?
The throne is a glorious sepulchre.
Lovely. Predictable, but lovely.
It takes a social climber to recognize a social climber.
Friendship and conversation is the heart of any success, wouldn't you say?
I see Rome's charms work.
I have better things to do and more important people with whom to speak.
We have taken your delegation to the chariot races where they, unfortunately, cheered for the Greens. We return to you those who remain.
Teach your delegation better manners, then perhaps.
We send to you a troupe of dancers to re-enact Leda and the Swan. Try not to be too scandalized.
Shocking. I've heard worse.
Look at yourself. Your people suffer injustices, your friends desert you, and it appears that your tailor is on strike. (Denounces You)
Come and see the ships pass through the straits, hear the charioteer's call in the hippodrome, come and see our glory.
I am agreeable, given the right agreement.
Let us show you our empire and its delights!
You have my ear.
I have always known the value of a partnership. Shall we create one?
Battles are so much more entertaining in the Hippodrome.
Our troops have come all this way, just to go home?
Battles of wit and words, of sport and skill, are so much more interesting.
We know that we stand at the crossroads of the world.
We control the crossroads of the world, which enables us to say no.
Our empire extends its reach; shall you assist us in this?
Come to our empire as friends, as visitors, as pilgrims. But not as soldiers.
Come now, you can do better.
Let us bring this into being.
